Summary: Struck a mountain while en route.
Name: Venezuela

Summary: Shot down by rebels near the Namibia border as it took off.
Name: Angola

Summary: Crash in the Andes mountains in poor weather while flying from Mendoza, Argentina to Santiago, Chile. The plane was found on the south slope of Tupungato peak at the 18,000 ft. level on January 19, 2000, 53 years later. Possibly icing or possibly the aircraft, being capable of flying over 20,000 feet, encountered strong head winds and began a descent thinking they were over their destination when they were not. The plane was named 'Star Dust.'
Name: Argentina

Summary: The cargo plane disappeared en route.
Name: Bolivia

Summary: The aircraft descended below MDA in poor weather and struck Taquari Hill which was obscured by clouds.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Crashed short of the runway in whiteout conditions. Improper  procedures by crew in whiteout weather conditions.
Name: Canada

Summary: Crashed while attempting to land. Ran into heavy icing. One wing broke off.
Name: China

Summary: Crashed short of the runway after attempting an emergency return to the airport after takeoff. Engine failure.
Name: Colombia

Summary: Icing on the wing caused the plane to crash close to the plane's destination.
Name: Germany

Summary: The military plane crashed on the southeast coast of Spain.
Name: Spain

Summary: Crashed during a training flight.
Name: France

Summary: Crashed while on approach.
Name: Indonesia

Summary: While descending through 5,000ft, the crew lost the No.1 engine. At 1,500 ft. the other engine was also lost. The aircraft crashed 3,300 ft. short of the runway. Failure of both engines on the aircraft.
Name: Italy

Summary: Turned the wrong way while attempting to land and slammed into a mountain, bursting into flames.
Name: Japan

Summary: The cargo plane crashed into a mountain in poor visibility.
Name: Mexico

Summary: Cashed on takeoff.
Name: Peru

Summary: Landed short and crashed into a tree during it's approach. Possible faulty altimiter. The weather was clear.
Name: Philippines

Summary: Crashed in poor weather condtions.
Name: Russia

Summary: The cargo plane crashed.
Name: Venezuela

Summary: Overshot the runway in heavy fog and crashed into the ocean while landing.
Name: Angola

Summary: Struck a truck while attempting to land.
Name: Argentina

Summary: Crashed into mountain while en route.
Name: Bolivia

Summary: Flew into the side of a hill towards the end of the flight while flying VOR.  The crew flew along the wrong valley.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Communication was lost with the aircraft soon after takeoff. Failure of corroded skin along the bottom center line of the aircraft which resulted in structural failure of the fuselage and aerial disintegration.
Name: Canada

Summary: Crashed while en route about 30 minutes after takeoff.
Name: China

Summary: The pilot tried to make an emergency landing back at the airport when the No. 2 engine began to overspeed. A belly landing was made in a field and the aircraft broke up and caught fire.
Name: Colombia

Summary: Hit the ground prematurely while attempting to land.
Name: Germany

Summary: Crashed into Pandols Mountain while en route.
Name: Spain

Summary: The transport was taking part in a parachute drop mission with five other aircraft when it crashed.
Name: France

Summary: The aircraft crashed into buildings during an attempted emergency landing after an engine caught fire shortly after taking off.
Name: Indonesia

Summary: Crashed  1,200 meters short of the runway and hit a tree and caught fire in heavy rain on a night approach. Improper IFR operation. Misused or failed to use flaps. Descended below decision height. The aircraft was named 'Clipper Caribbean.'
Name: India

Summary: Crashed into a hanger during a practice landing. The accident was attributed to a balked landing maneuver carried out below the speed limits for safe directional control of the aircraft during a critical situation that developed in the last phase of the landing in the course of a simulated emergency exercise with two power units inoperative.
Name: Italy

Summary: Crashed 3 miles southwest of Itami Air Base shortly after taking off.  Loss of engine power for reasons unknown.
Name: Japan

Summary: Crashed into a sand dune while attempting to land at Lima in heavy fog. Improper IFR procedures by the crew
Name: Peru

Summary: Inadvertent contact with the water during low-level flight over open ocean while searching for survivors.
Name: Philippines

Summary: The cargo plane flew into high ground while on approach in poor weather conditons.
Name: Russia

Summary: Crash landed onto Cruces de Daji mountain in the Andes eight minutes after taking off off from Merida.
Name: Venezuela

Summary: Shot down by surface-to-air missile launced by UNITA rebels.
Name: Angola

Summary: Struck an obstacle on landing.
Name: Argentina

Summary: Crashed in mountainous terrain while en route.
Name: Bolivia

Summary: Crashed on takeoff hitting power lines and roof tops before coming to rest in a market square. Uncontained failure of the right engine.
Name: Brazil

Summary: The aircraft crashed about 5 minutes after leaving Dorval Airport in Montreal. Icing of the pitot system or failure of the vertical gyro or an unprogrammed and unnoticed extension of the Pitch Trim Compensator.
Name: Canada

Summary: Crashed into mountains 120 miles south of Chunking.
Name: China

Summary: During a VOR approach, crashed 2 miles short of the runway.
Name: Colombia

Summary: Crashed on takeoff.
Name: Germany

Summary: Crashed on takeoff.
Name: Spain

Summary: Crashed into Mt. Canigou while descending to land. Navigational error.
Name: France

Summary: Shortly after takeoff the left engine failed. The aircraft began to lose height in a left turn and crashed along the banks of Mentaya River.
Name: Indonesia

Summary: The aircraft crashed in a nearly vertical attitude, 5 minutes after takeoff, 20 nm from the airport.
Name: India

Summary: Overran the runway while taking off, cashed and burst into flames. Windshear.
Name: Italy

Summary: Crashed into the sea near Okinawa due to engine failure.
Name: Japan

Route: Los Angeles, CA  - Mexico City, Mexico
Summary: The aircraft struck a vehicle after landing on a closed runway in fog. The tower warned the flight three times about the closed runway. Non-compliance with the meteorological minima for the approach procedure, as cleared.  Failure to comply with the aircraft's operating procedures during the approach phase, and landing on a runway closed to traffic.
Name: Mexico

Summary: After initiating an overshoot procedure, at the suggestion of the control tower, because it was too high, the aircraft proceded to start another approach when it crashed into La Cruz Peak. Possible misinterpretation of navigation instruments.
Name: Peru

Summary: Cashed into the sea. In-flight structural failure due to air loads exceeding the design strength, while flying into a thunderstorm cell.
Name: Philippines

Summary: While taking off the aircraft veered to the right and clipped some trees 2,000 ft. past the runway. Overloaded and possible fuel contamination.
Name: Russia

Summary: At a height of 3,000 ft., the aircraft suddenly nosed  into the sea, 3 minutes after taking off.
Name: Venezuela

Summary: Following engine failure, the captain lost control and crashed while trying to land.
Name: Argentina

Summary: Crashed on its delivery flight from England to Brisbane after in-flight loss of control, probably due to the type's design deficiencies.
Name: Australia

Summary: Crashed into Andies peak while en route. Wreckage found 100 miles northeast of Cochabamba.
Name: Bolivia

Summary: Crashed 8km short of the runway in darkness.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Crashed 1,000 feet short of the Argentia, NAS runway.
Name: Canada

Summary: The plane ditched into the PacifiOcean 80 miles west of Laoaq after a fire broke out in the No. 2 engine.
Name: China

Summary: While attempting to land the pilot continued VFR flight in IFR conditions and collided with a hill.
Type: de Havilland Canada DHC-6 Twin Otter 300
Name: Colombia

Summary: Engine failure.
Name: Germany

Summary: Crashed into the sea following engine failure.
Name: Spain

Summary: Crashed shortly after takeoff, not gaining altitude and colliding with trees. Crew did not properly monitor altimeter.
Name: France

Summary: Crashed into Mt. Klabat in heavy fog while descending for a landing.
Name: Indonesia

Summary: Undershot the runway and struck a concrete obstruction in poor weather conditions. Lack of information supplied to the pilot regarding the true conditions of surface visibility which was below the minimum prescribed for a night landing.  Lack of proper monitoring and possibly incorrect setting of altimeters during the approach to land. The use of landing lights which resulted in glare during the final stages of the approach in foggy conditions
Name: India

Summary: The DC-3 was to fly the Yemenite Under Secretary of Foreign Affairs from Rome to Belgrade. The aircraft The aircraft crashed on the western slopes of Mount Porretta at an elevation of 2,690 feet due to a navagation error. Pilot error.
Name: Italy

Summary: Crashed into a utility pole short of the runway in heavy fog.
Type: de Havilland Canada DHC-6 Twin Otter 300
Name: Mexico

Summary: Crashed into the jungle near San Ramon.
Name: Peru

Summary: Crashed into a mountain in poor weather. Pilot error. Decision to fly VFR over rugged terrain in IFR conditions.
Name: Philippines

Summary: The aircraft suddenly pitched down and crashed while on approach. Icing.
Name: Russia

Summary: En route from New York City, the airliner crashed in the Caribbean sea and exploded while descending for a landing  at Maiquetia Airport. Possible sensory illusion produced by the town lights on upslope. The aircraft was named 'Clipper Malay.'
Name: Venezuela

Summary: Crashed and burned in dense fog while enroute.
Name: Argentina

Summary: Crashed into Rodeo Pampa mountain during approach, 37 miles from its destination.
Name: Bolivia

Summary: Crashed in a rainstorm.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Loss of control due to improperly secured heavy cargo breaking loose and sliding to the rear of the aircraft during takeoff.
Name: Canada

Summary: Crashed into  a mountain while on approach.
Name: China

Summary: Following several attempts to land the pilot decided to hold until weather conditions improved.  Contact was lost with the plane and it flew into the ground. Visibility was reduced by low lying fog.
Name: Colombia

Summary: Pilot error.
Name: Germany

Summary: Crashed in Gredos mountain range about 100 miles west of Madrid while en route. The plane was named 'Ruta de Colon.'
Name: Spain

Summary: Midair collision.
Name: France

Summary: The plane made a forced landing during poor weather conditions and crashed into trees on a ridge. All passengers survived but one elderly passenger died while waiting for rescue.
Name: Indonesia

Summary: Crashed into high terrain, 12 miles west of its proper course, due to a navigation error. Abandonment of the ILS approach at too early a stage during an attempt to land under conditions of poor visibility in fog.
Name: India

Summary: Midair collision with an Italian Air Force F-86. The airliner drifted off course. Neither pilot saw each other before they collided.
Name: Italy

Summary: Flew into a mountain.
Type: de Havilland Canada DHC-6 Twin Otter 100
Name: Mexico

Summary: While flying at FL 150, the pilot radioed he was returning to Huanuco because of bad weather. Soon after, the plane was seen spiraling towards the ground and witnesses heard the engines accelerate before the aircraft hit a hill. Separation of the left elevator in flight.
Name: Peru

Summary: The plane crashed at the west end of of the runway on takeoff while on a demonstration flight. Overloaded.
Name: Philippines

Summary: Pitched up and crashed on takeoff. Overweight and improperly loaded.
Name: Russia

Summary: The plane crashed while returning to the airport for an emergency landing after the No. 1 engine failed on takeoff.
Name: Venezuela

Summary: Crashed into Mar Chiquita Lagoon during a heavy rainstorm.
Name: Argentina

Summary: Crashed en route during the 265 miles sea route.
Name: Australia

Summary: The predeparture check lists were carried out by the first officer, while the captain arrived late. The aircraft s taxied out immediately and it is presumed that the crew did not carry out the pretakeoff checklist. The airplane took off,  entered a steep climb and turned right. Shortly afterwards the plane dove into the sea. Both pilots had very little experience on Bandeirante planes.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Loss of the No. 2 engine necessitated a forced crash landing near a railway station.  Failure to maintain height at night due to the loss of the starboard engine in icing conditions.  The aircraft was also overloaded.
Name: Canada

Summary: Crashed into a 14,000 ft. mountain.
Name: China

Summary: Eight minutes after takeoff the No. 2 engine failed.  The pilot turned back but crashed 1 mile short of the runway.  The passengers were told to throw out cargo after which unfortunately they all moved towards the tail leading to a loss of control.
Name: Colombia

Summary: Caught fire as the airliner struck the side of a hill.
Name: Germany

Summary: Crashed in the Llaveria mountains in heavy fog and caught fire. The plane hit the highest peak of the mountains.
Name: Spain

Summary: Struck the water and sank after the right wing tip float contacted the water during a shallow turn for final approach.
Name: France

Summary: The helicopter crashed into the sea.
Name: Indonesia

Summary: The cargo plane crashed while dropping supplies.
Name: India

Summary: The aircraft strayed off the assigned airway and hit a mountain. The pilot did not follow the airways assigned in the flight plan. He did not check his direction and position along the new route.
Name: Italy

Location: San Cristobal de las Casas, Mexico
Route: Palenque - San Cristobal de las Casas
Summary: Exploded, crashed and burned on approach.
Name: Mexico

Summary: Crashed into a Cerro Baco mountain.
Name: Peru

Summary: Crashed after undershooting the runway. Loss of control at low altitude. Improper loading which placed the center of gravity in back of the center of gravity limits of the plane.
Name: Philippines

Summary: The cargo plane failed to gain altitude, overran the runway and crashed.
Name: Russia

Summary: Crashed while en route. Navigation error. Failure of the crew to follow the prescribed route. Flying VFR in IFR conditions.
Name: Venezuela

Summary: Crashed after in-flight loss of control, possibly stalled at low altitude in dusty low-visibility conditions
Name: Australia

Summary: Crashed on takeoff.
Name: Bolivia

Summary: The pilot,, switched to VFR in IFR conditions, struck trees 1 km short of runway in heavy ground fog. Pilot error.
Name: Brazil

Summary: For reasons undetermined, the right engine failed and as a result of being overloaded, the aircraft did not maintain altitude on one engine and struck the ground with the right wingtip. A possible contributing factor was the failure of the co-pilot's vacuum-driven gyro instruments, without his knowledge.
Name: Canada

Summary: The aircraft crashed 1 mile from the airfiend shortly after takeoff due to engine failure.
Name: China

Summary: Crashed into a jungle mountain, Mt. Los Farllones, in poor weather.
Name: Colombia

Summary: Crashed while landing in fog.
Name: Spain

Summary: A first ILS attempt to land at Orly Airport failed. The crew decided to try a second time with GCA guidance. Full power was applied when the crew was not able to see the runway. The aircraft continued to descend impacting the ground in a right bank. The right wing separated and the main fuselage broke-up into four parts. Stalling, as a result of delayed application of power in a final approach configuration and inadequate control of heading, airspeed and altitude after the visual was lost.
Name: France

Summary: Ditched into the Java Sea after experiencing mechanical problems with the right engine and being unable to maintain altitude. The crew shut down the engine and feathered the propeller but could not maintain altitude despite jettisoning luggage out of the aircraft.
Name: Indonesia

Summary: Exploded in the air after takeoff.
Name: India

Summary: Crashed into a mountain while on approach. Navigational error due to failure to use radio equipment.
Name: Italy

Summary: The aircraft hit high ground during an approach, 32 kms from the airport.
Name: Mexico

Summary: Crashed into a  mountain while en route..
Name: Peru

Summary: Cashed in poor weather. Misjudgment of the terrain clearance, which resulted in the collision with trees in severe turbulence and strong gusty winds.
Name: Philippines

Summary: After three landing attempts at Tura, the crew diverted to Vanavarva because of bad weather. The aircraft ran out of fuel and crashed on a river bank about 40 km from Vanavera.
Name: Russia

Summary: The aircraft crashed after an explosion aboard. Detonation of a hand-grenade brought aboard by a Russian immigrant. The explosion occurred after the captain tried to disarm the man.
Name: Venezuela

Summary: Crashed while en route in the Andes mountains after encountering a thunderstorm.
Name: Bolivia

Route: Rio de Janeiro - Juiz De Flora
Summary: The jet overan the wet runway fell off a cliff and caught fire. Plane overloaded, pilot did not make the proper calcualtions for landing.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Last know coordinates 46' 15' N, 46'31'W, over the North Atlantic. A distress message was received. No trace of the aircraft or its occupants were ever found.
Name: Canada

Summary: Struck Mt. El Saluda at 5,000 ft., near Image, after announcing a go-around with intentions of diverting to their alternate.
Name: Colombia

Summary: Engine failure.
Name: Germany

Summary: Crashed in a steep angle of attack.
Name: France

Summary: Crashed while making an approach.
Type: de Havilland Canada DHC-6 Twin Otter 300
Name: Indonesia

Summary: Crashed en route.
Name: India

Summary: Crashed in the Alps on the French/Italian border while en route. The instrument flight plan the pilot filed indicated a cruising height that was lower than the authorized minimum altitude required to clear the mountains.
Name: Italy

Summary: The aircraft crashed following a fire onboard while en route.
Name: Mexico

Summary: Crashed into a hillside while en route.
Name: Peru

Summary: Crashed and burned while attempting to land with an engine fire in poor visibility and heavy rain.
Name: Russia

Summary: While en route,  flying VFR the plane ran into a cloud covered El Callejon pass  at 7,000 feet. The aircraft made a 180deg turn but crashed into the La Culata Peak at an altitude of 13,500 feet. Flying of the aircraft at an insufficient altitude over an area apparently unfamiliar to the pilot.
Name: Venezuela

Summary: Crashed after an aborted landing following landing  too fast and 2/3rds down the runway. The pilot attempted a go-around, became airborne but stalled and crashed into houses and a car killing two people.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Crashed into a row of houses shortly after taking off from Dorval Airport.
Name: Canada

Summary: Disappeared while en route. Plane never located.
Name: China

Summary: The plane burst into flames and crashed shortly after taking off from El Dorado Airport. Detonation of an explosive device placed on the floor on the starboard side of the passenger cabin at seat 15F which ignited fuel vapors in an empty fuel tank. The bomb was placed by members of the drug cartel headed by Pablo Escobar in an attempt to kill presidental candidate Cesare Gaviria. He was not aboard the flight.
Name: Colombia

Summary: Pilot error.
Name: Germany

Route: Rome - Paris -  Shannon - New York City
Summary: Lost altitude on takeoff and crashed into a house. Failed to climb for reasons unknown. The aircraft's slight loss of altitude soon after take off was the main cause of the accident. There is no explanation for this loss of altitude. Orchestra and opera conductor Guido Cantelli, 36, among those killed.
Name: France

Summary: Crashed into a ravine while attempting to land.
Type: de Havilland Canada DHC-6 Twin Otter 100
Name: Indonesia

Summary: Went into a steep dive and crashed into a field. Cause unknown.
Name: India

Summary: The aircraft broke up in-flight and crashed into the sea en route from Rome to Cairo. Metal fatigue due to a design flaw led to the breakup of the aircraft. Third crash with the same cause. The aircraft was nicknamed 'Yoke Yoke.'
Name: Italy

Summary: Crashed into a hill on approach. The plane was carrying Mexican journalists covering the presidential campaign.
Name: Mexico

Summary: Crashed in adjacent mountains while attempting an emergency landing following an engine fire.
Name: Peru

Summary: The aircraft veered to the left after taking off. The pilot lost control and crashed. Failure of the pilot to set the rudder trim tab to the proper position before takeoff and during the flight. Undetected deflection of the rudder trim tab.
Name: Philippines

Summary: The aircraft crashed after a captain allowed his child to manipulate the controls of the plane. The pilot's 11 year old daughter and 16 year old son were taking turns in the pilot's seat. While the boy was flying, he inadvertently disengaged the autopilot linkage to the ailerons and put the airliner in a bank of 90 degrees which caused the nose to drop sharply. The co-pilot pulled back on the yoke to obtain level flight but the plane stalled. With his seat pulled all the way back, the co-pilot in the right hand seat could not properly control the aircraft. After several stalls and rapid pull-ups the plane went into a spiral descent. In the end the co-pilot initiated a 4.8g pull-up and nearly regained a stable flight path but the aircraft struck the ground in an almost level attitude killing all aboard. The aircraft was named Glinka, after Mikhail Glinka, the father of Russian music.
Name: Russia

Summary: Crashed into the Alto del Cedro mountain. Premature descent. Navigation error. Lack of navigation facilities in the area.
Name: Venezuela

Location: Near Sao Jose do Xingu, Brazil
Summary: The aircraft ran out of fuel due to a navigation error and crashed into the jungle. The crew entered a heading of 027 degrees instead of 270 into the flight computer.  Although the flight from Maraba to Belem was supposed to last 45 minutes, after two hours, the captain still thought he was flying in the right direction. The course was finally corrected but the plane ran out of fuel and crashed into the jungle.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Crashed into mountainous terrain in low visibility while en route.
Name: China

Summary: Crashed into a mountain.
Type: de Havilland Canada DHC-6 Twin Otter 300
Name: Colombia

Summary: Crashed after penetrating a thunderstorm.
Name: Germany

Summary: The cargo plane was on approach when it crashed.
Name: France

Summary: Crashed into a ditch while attempting to land at Ruteng.
Type: de Havilland Canada DHC-6 Twin Otter 300
Name: Indonesia

Summary: Cashed 25 miles from Amritsar. Structural failure of the aircraft in the air, following overstressing, as a result of loss of control. The loss of control was caused by improper rigging of the rudder bungee system.
Name: India

Summary: Crashed in a steep dive while making an IFR landing in turbulence following an engine fire. Probably lost a wing during a pull out from a steep dive.
Name: Italy

Summary: During an approach, the plane undershot the runway and landed about a mile short, hitting an embankment . The plane became airborne again until the undercarriage and forward fuselage struck a railway embankment and broke up. Undetermined cause.
Name: Mexico

Summary: Crashed into a hill in poor weather conditions while en route.
Name: Peru

Summary: Crashed and burned on Penay Island on a domestiflight. The plane hit Mt. Madiaat 7,000 ft. in rain, wind and low clouds.
Name: Philippines

Summary: While on approach the nose pitched up, the aircraft stalled and crashed short of the runway. Icing of the horizontal stabilizer.
Name: Russia

Summary: Strayed off course and collided with a mountain in the Penas Blancas hills.  Pilot error.  Weather's influence on radio communications. Leaving the prescribed route and flying at too low an altitude.
Name: Venezuela

Summary: The plane crashed into houses during a steep approach. Crew error. High speed approach. Deep stall. This was the Boeing 707 used in the movie 'Airport' in 1970.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Shifting of cargo after takeoff cause the plane to take a nose-high attitude, stall and crash into houses.
Name: Colombia

Summary: Crashed in fog.
Name: Spain

Summary: Broke up in midair while flying through a thunderstorm.
Name: France

Summary: The aircraft crashed on approach during heavy rain after hitting an antenna. Windshear.
Name: Indonesia

Summary: Stuck a mountain in poor weather.
Name: India

Summary: The aircraft broke up in-flight while en route from Rome to London. Metal fatigue due to a design flaw caused a breakup of the aircraft. Second crash with the same cause. The aircraft was nicknamed 'Yoke Peter.'
Name: Italy

Summary: Crashed into a mountain.
Name: Mexico

Summary: Struck a mountain as the plane approached Huanuco.
Name: Peru

Summary: Crashed and burned on a forested mountain slope on Mt. Tangcong Vaca. Misjudgment of clearance with the ground by the crew which resulted in collision with trees.
Name: Philippines

Summary: A sudden pitch-up during approach led the crew to go-around.  The pitch-up continued until the plane stalled and crashed.  Improperly loaded baggage shifted the center of gravity beyond the acceptable limit.
Name: Russia

Summary: Struck Silla de Caracas Mountain at 6,700 feet while approaching to land at Maiquetia. Navigation error. The pilot did not follow prescribed approach procedures. St. Louis Cardinal outfielder, Charlie Peete, 27, killed.
Name: Venezuela

Summary: Wreckage found 10/26/1958.
Name: Australia

Summary: Crashed into the AtlantiOcean while en route for reasons unknown.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Crashed and burned on takeoff striking a hill.  Possible engine failure or overloading.
Name: China

Summary: Crashed while en route.
Name: Colombia

Summary: Fuselage failure.
Name: Germany

Location: Near St. Etienne de Tinee, France
Summary: The aircraft struck a mountain and disintegrated at an altitude of 8,000 ft. while en route. The accident occurred in snow and low overcast conditions. The plane had drifted off the prescribed course and no wind drift correction had been made.
Name: France

Summary: Crash into a mountain.
Name: Indonesia

Summary: Stalled and crashed.
Name: India

Summary: Crashed into a mountain after being blown off course by a storm while en route.
Name: Mexico

Summary: The aircraft lost control and crashed following a blown tire on takeoff.
Name: Peru

Summary: After losing the No. 1 engine the pilot decided to return to Kalibo but could not land do to poor weather. He attempted to divert to Bacolod but could not climb to avoid terrain and crashed into a fish pond while attempting to ditch in the sea.  Failure to maintain safe single engine speed and altitude following failure of the left engine. The precipitation and poor visibility prevailing at the time of the accident over Kalibo and its vicinity and the failure on the part of the maintenance personnel to take action to correct discrepancies logged in the aircraft log-book, individually or collectively contributed to the cause of the accident.
Name: Philippines

Summary: After climbing to a height of 800 ft. the plane dove into the ground. Improper loading and overloaded.
Name: Russia

Summary: Ditched into the sea.
Name: Venezuela

Summary: Following the conclusion of an aerial tour carrying Sir John Salmond, the aircraft departed Adelaide piloted by C. W. A. Scott with an engineer as passenger. Control was lost in the cloud during an attempt to cross the Adelaide Hills; the aircraft crashed and caught fire.
Name: Australia

Summary: Crashed during takeoff.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Crashed into a mountain while en route.
Name: China

Summary: Shortly after taking off the crew experienced failure of the No. 4 engine and a fire. While attemping to return to the airport control was lost and the plane crashed.
Name: Colombia

Summary: Crashed full speed into a hill, 450 feet high in rain and fog. Pilot error.
Name: Germany

Summary: While on approach to land at Nice-Cote d' Azur Airport the aircraft crashed into Mt. Cemet in the French Alps. French violinist Jacques Tribaud, 72, among those killed. Navigational error. Pilot deviated from the prescribled route for reasons unknown.
Name: France

Summary: Crashed into high ground at 1, 900 ft. while flying IFR in rain.
Name: Indonesia

Summary: The cargo plane crashed while dropping supplies and making a narrow turn in a valley. The accident was attributed to an error in navigation which caused the pilot to enter the wrong valley. During an attempt to turn back in a restricted area, the aircraft stalled and crashed.
Name: India

Summary: After failure of all four engines the plane ditched into the Mediterranean Sea. The initial failure of the No. 1 and 2 engines for reasons unknown.
Name: Italy

Summary: While operating on its inaugural flight the aircraft crashed into a mountain en route after getting lost.
Name: Mexico

Summary: Crashed on takeoff.
Name: Peru

Summary: Crashed 1,600m short of the runway threshold while attempting to land at Chita.
Name: Russia

Summary: The cargo plane crashed into a mountain.
Name: Venezuela

Summary: On a delivery flight the aircraft struck a clound covered mountain at 4,300 ft. Crew did not follow the prescribed course.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Struck a radio transmission tower while on approach for landing at Nanyman field.
Name: China

Summary: The aircraft crashed while attempting to make an emergency landing.
Type: de Havilland Canada DHC-6 Twin Otter 310
Name: Colombia

Summary: Crashed into a grove of small trees and burst into flames while trying to land in heavy fog.
Name: France

Summary: Crashed into a mountain.
Name: Indonesia

Summary: Crashed while en route. Navigational error. The pilot entered a wrong valley and stalled the fully loaded aircraft while attempting to turn back.
Name: India

Summary: Hit the north slope of La Cinta mountain range while en route.  Pilot did not maintain a safe altitude. The pilots ignorance of wind conditions which allowed the aircraft to drift 3 degrees off course.
Name: Italy

Summary: Crashed into a residential neighborhood while attempting to return to the airport following an engine failure.
Name: Mexico

Route: Santiago, Chili - Arequipa, Peru - Lima, Peru
Summary: The aircraft crashed into the Mt. Chaparra in the Andes mountains while en route.  Action of the pilot in continuing the flight on instruments in the overcast, contrary to company flight procedure of which, according to the evidence, the pilot was aware.
Name: Peru

Summary: While attempting to land at Clark Air Force Base, the aircraft contacted the perimeter fence, 3,500 ft. from the threshold of the runway, causing the plane to clip the tower and crash 300 ft. left of the runway center line.
Name: Philippines

Summary: Crashed on takeoff. The aircraft became airborne but then stalled and crashed. Engine failure.
Name: Russia

Summary: Lost altitude and ditched near shore after taking off.
Name: Venezuela

Summary: The crew accidently tried to take off from a taxiway. The takeoff was aborted but the aircraft overran the runway and collided with a embankment and broke in two. There was heavy fog in the area.
Name: Brazil

Operator: Military - United States Army Air Force
Name: China

Summary: Crashed into a 8,500 ft. mountain in poor weather.
Type: de Havilland Canada DHC-6 Twin Otter 300
Name: Colombia

Summary: The aircraft crashed during a violent storm near the Swiss - Germany border. The plane fell from a height of 3,000 feet, bursting into flames.
Name: Germany

Type: de Havilland Canada DHC-6 Twin Otter 300
Name: Indonesia

Summary: Sustained structural failure while flying through a thunderstorm.
Name: India

Summary: The aircraft plunged to the ground from 6,500 feet after being struck by lightning. Lightning ignited a mixture of air and fuel fumes in the fuel tank.
Name: Italy

Summary: Crashed due to bomb explosion.
Name: Mexico

Route: Cotabato - Malabang - Iligan - Cayagan de Oro
Summary: Struck trees on a mountain ridge and crashed while attempting to land. Continued flight under VFR into IFR conditions.
Name: Philippines

Summary: Crashed into power lines at 40m during an approach to land.
Name: Russia

Summary: Crashed into the summit on Cerro Grande Mountain.
Name: Venezuela

Summary: The pilot of the cargo plane stayed at a low altitude after taking off in IMC conditons and crashed.
Name: Brazil

Summary: The cargo plane struck a mountain in the Himalayas under poor weather conditions.
Name: China

Summary: Crashed into the Amazon jungle in poor weather, after the crew reported a fire in the No. 3 engine. The last words from the aircraft was 'We're falling.'
Name: Colombia

Summary: Weather related.
Name: Germany

Summary: After taking off, the plane was observed turning to the left until it turned on its back and crashed. Malfunction of ailerons. The gear chain of the co-pilot's control column slipped off the sprocket and jammed the aileron controls.
Name: France

Summary: Struck a mountain in poor weather conditions.
Name: Indonesia

Summary: The cargo plane crashed during an attempt by the pilot to clear high terrain under poor visibility conditions. He had previously descended to a low altitude in order to determine his position.
Name: India

Summary: Crashed into Bari Harbor while en route from Cairo via Athens to Rome. Witnesses observed smoke from an engine followed by smoke from the other engines and fuselage prior to the crash. The plane broke-up in flight.
Name: Italy

Summary: The plane crashed while on approah. Careless and untimely descent in the course of a procedure turn which was continued below established minimum altitude.
Name: Mexico

Summary: Crashed into Mt. Boca during descent for landing. Limited visibility, crosswinds contributing to navigational error.
Name: Philippines

Summary: While en route, the aircraft cashed into trees and burst into flames.
Name: Russia

Summary: The aircraft crashed into mountains shortly after taking off.  Pilot error. The captain decided to cross the Seven Lagoons mountain range in severe overcast, thinking that he was 30 kms further north, where the range drops to 2,000m. Instead, he flew into 4,000m cliffs. In the last seconds, he realized he was in trouble and tried to gain altitude. For a hundred meters or so he cut through small trees, but finally crashed. A small fire followed.
Name: Venezuela

Summary: The plane stalled and crashed into an emergency vehicle while making an emergency landing attempt after an engine caught fire. A faulty fuel injection nozzle caused a blow torch effect damaging the compressor turbine vane ring and causing thermal fatigue and loss of one of the turbine blades.The resulting imbalance ruptured the starting control bypass fuel return line.
Name: Brazil

Route: Bogota - San Vicente del Caguán - Florencia
Summary: The domestiflight crashed into a mountain while attempting to land at Florencia in rain and fog.
Name: Colombia

Summary: Crashed after striking an obstacle while landing in poor visibility.
Name: Germany

Summary: Abnormal flight maneuver made when the crew experienced difficulty in resuming normal flight on the two engines. Overspeed, reduction of pitch or difficulty in restarting the engine may have created a dangerous situation and caused the aircraft to stall in dissymmetrical flight, thus subjecting the airframe to stresses accompanied by buffeting which was either alternating or exceeded the design limits of the structure and caused the tail-plane to break off.
Name: France

Summary: Crashed into a mountain while en route.
Name: Indonesia

Summary: While manoeuvring at a low height in mountainous terrain during a supply dropping mission the port wing of the cargo plane grazed the side of a hill thus causing the aircraft to slew and crash. A contributory factor might have been the mismanagement of the fuel system which caused temporary loss of engine power and height.
Name: India

Summary: The aircraft was returning on a flight from Lisboa to Milan with the Torino Soccer Team when the crew decided to land directly at Turin, homebase to the team. In low visibility, rain and thunderstorms, the left wing of the plane struck a wall surrounding the sanctuary of Superga, a mountain near Turin. The aircraft then pivoted, and disintegrated next to the sanctuary killing all aboard.  Error in navigation and poor visiblity.
Name: Italy

Summary: Crashed while attempting to land and caught fire.
Name: Mexico

Summary: Crashed while practicing take offs and landings.
Name: Philippines

Summary: The aircraft crashed 1.5 miles from the airport during approach. Poor landing coordination by the flight crew.
Name: Russia

Summary: The cargo plane disappeared en route.
Name: Venezuela

Location: Near Sao Pedro d' Aldeia, Brazil
Summary: The aircraft flew into heavy rain and a cloud shrouded hill after the pilot abandoned IFR and descended VFR. The plane was carrying journalists.
Name: Brazil

Summary: The cargo plane flew into Digboi Mountain after losing both engines.
Name: China

Summary: Crashed into a mountain at 11,500 ft.  In rainand fog.  Flying under VFR when conditions changed to IFR.
Type: de Havilland Canada DHC-6 Twin Otter 300
Name: Colombia

Summary: Crashed on a test flight before delivery to Eurasia in China.
Name: Germany

Summary: Flew into Mt. Dore.
Name: France

Summary: Crashed into a mountain at approximately 3,000 ft. while attempting to land.
Name: Indonesia

Summary: A fire in fligth caused by a failure of the No. 1 engine. During the ensuing forced landing on rough terrain the aircraft broke up and was consumed by fire.
Name: India

Summary: Crashed into Mt. Arbetello in poor visibility. Poor visibility and geographical features made recognition of terrain difficult and likely mislead the pilot into believing he was out at sea.
Name: Italy

Summary: Crashed while approaching to land.
Name: Mexico

Summary: Crashed on takeoff. Failure of the No. 1 engine shortly after take-off but after V2. Inappropriate emergency procedures by crew.
Name: Philippines

Summary: A missed approach was followed by the left wing and landing gear hitting the runway which led to a stall and crash, right of the runway.
Name: Russia

Summary: Crashed during a landing attempt.
Name: Venezuela

Summary: Midair collision.  Same aircraft type, same airline. One of 17 killed aboard PT-GKL and all 18 aboard PT-GJZ were killed. PT-GJZ crashed out of control but PT-GKL was able to make a forced landing without its No.1 engine on a river after which it sank.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Diverted to Kweilin after Chunking was below minimums. After holding over Kweilin for 3 hours, the aircraft ran out of gas, hit mountain and was demolished.
Name: China

Summary: The aircraft crashed into a mountain at 8,500 ft. while descending to land at Buga. Continued VFR flight into deteriorating weather conditions.
Name: Colombia

Summary: No. 1 engine failed shortly after taking off.  Altitude could not be maintained and an emergency belly landing was made in a field. The disconnecting of the articulated control rod of the propeller governor due to the lack of a split pin on the governor spindle and to the nut of the ball-joint of the control spindle having been unscrewed by force.
Name: France

Summary: Crashed shortly after taking off. Improper observation and interpretation of instruments. The captain did not properly observe and interpret his flight instruments and thus inadvertently permitted the aircraft to descend to the ground immediately after a night takeoff during which no visual reference was possible.
Name: India

Summary: The aircraft crashed during takeoff in fog.
Name: Italy

Summary: Crashed on the slopes of a mountain in dense fog.
Name: Mexico

Summary: Crashed into Mt. Baco while en route. Navigational error under adverse weather conditions.
Name: Philippines

Summary: The aircraft crashed into high ground 5 km short of the runway in poor weather during a VFR approach.
Name: Russia

Summary: Crashed while landing.
Name: Brazil

Summary: The plane discintigrated in mid-aid. The jack pad had been removed from the right wing root. This left 4 large holes directly under the fuel tanks and directly in line with the exhaust. When the throttles were cut to descend, the flame only went as far back as the holes. There the flames went up around the fuel tank, igniting the fumes and blew the wing off.
Name: China

Summary: Tried to make an emergency landing. Touched down, lifted off, stalled and crashed.
Name: Colombia

Summary: Crashed into mountainous terrain in the Spessart mountains in fog.
Name: Germany

Summary: Flew into a mountain in the Pyrenees.
Name: France

Summary: While making a sharp turn the cargo plane stalled and crashed.
Name: India

Summary: The pilot chose to fly the short distance between Florence and  Rome below the cloud base. The weather suddenly became worse and the plane entered clouds at low level, drifted off course and struck a hill.
Name: Italy

Summary: An in-flight explosion occurred in the passenger cabin. A male passenger, who was believed to have been carrying a bomb, fell from the airplane from an altitude of 11,000ft.  A forced landing was made at Poza Rica after a fire broke out in the cabin.
Name: Mexico

Summary: After a loss of power in the No. 2 engine the crew was unable to feather the prop. An emergency descent was made and the plane ditched into the ocean. Upon contact with the water, the aft end of the fuselage broke free at the rear of the pressure bulkhead, the right wing  tore free and the engines separated. The wing floated for 3hrs, serving as a life raft for  passengers. The remainder of the fuselage, sank some 10 minutes after impact.  Passengers were rescued 6 hours after the accident. Failure of No. 2  engine, resulting in oil contamination, loss of oil supply, subsequent loss of the No. 2 propeller assembly and fire-in-flight, which necessitated a ditching.
Name: Philippines

Summary: Autopilot engagement and disengagement resulted in oscillations of the aircraft which led to a loss of control and break-up in mid air. Pilot-induced lateral oscillations led to a stall, dive and break-up.
Name: Russia

Summary: After two missed IFR approaches the aircraft struck the ground short of the runway threshold during a third VFR approach.
Name: Brazil

Summary: While enroute the crew got lost and crashed into 22,000 foot mountain in Tibet. Bad weather prevented the pilot from getting a bearing on any radio station.
Name: China

Summary: After liftoff, the aircraft entered a 90 degree bank, struck power lines and crashed into buildings. Failure of the No.3 engine during a climb out with the No.4 engine operating at idle.
Name: Colombia

Summary: The aircraft drifted 50 miles off the prescribed route and struck Mt. Tete de l'Obiou at 6,740 feet. The pilot probably realized the deviation and tried to take corrective action but did not see the mountain in time.
Name: France

Summary: The aircraft failed to gain altitude and overran the runway. Crew did not follow checklist procedures.
Name: Indonesia

Summary: During a training exercise the aircraft approached a stall entered a spin, partially recovered but crashed.
Name: India

Summary: Drifting 30 miles off the prescribed course, the aircraft crashed into snow covered mountains. The wreckage was discovered 8 months later.
Name: Italy

Summary: Exlpoded and caught fire near Bahia de Kino.  A bomb is believed to have exploded onboard.
Name: Mexico

Summary: A hard landing in heavy rain and gusty winds at Manila caused the collapse of the right main landing gear. A prop broke off the No. 3 engine, penetrated the cabin and killed one passenger. The aircraft was named 'Clipper Golden Gate.'
Name: Philippines

Summary: While on approach to Bugulma, the plane yawed to the right. The crew decided to go around but crashed 800 m short and to the right of the runway. Horizontal stabilizer icing.
Name: Russia

Summary: Crashed into the sea.
Name: Brazil

Summary: The cargo plane struck a mountain while attempting a go-around.
Name: China

Summary: Crashed into a mountain. Flying under VFR in IFR conditions, navigation error and lack of adequate training.
Type: de Havilland Canada DHC-6 Twin Otter 310
Name: Colombia

Summary: After circling in fog for half an hour, the plane rose to about 300 ft. and nose dived into the ground and burst into flames. Engine failure.
Name: Germany

Summary: The aircraft crashed in a snowstorm 200 meters below Mont Blansummit. The crew was warned by a Geneva controller to climb immediately. They acknowledged the message but soon after struck the mountain. The exact cause of the accident remains undetermined. Most likely the aircraft was caught in violent gust while trying to overfly the summit. The plane was named 'Malabar Princess.'
Name: France

Summary: The helicopter crashed into the sea.
Name: Indonesia

Summary: The accident is attributed to the insufficient altitude at which the aircraft was flown during an attempt to fly through a thunderstorm. Downdrafts and divergent winds encountered, forced the aircraft to the ground.
Name: India

Summary: Strayed off course, stuck tree tops and then crashed into Mt. Santa Maria del Monte. Pilot's failure to realize the plane strayed off course and was in mountainous territory.
Name: Italy

Summary: The plane crashed into La Latilla mountain 13 km west of Guadalajara. The aircraft did not climb out in accordance with approved procedures.
Name: Mexico

Summary: While taking off the plane stalled and hit trees. The uncontrollable stall at low altitude which resulted from the abrupt steep climb immediately after takeoff. Contributing factors were the improper loading of the aircraft and the prevailing gusty wind with a relatively high ambient temperature.
Name: Philippines

Summary: The plane ran out of fuel on the third approach in poor weather.
Name: Brazil

Summary: A navigational error caused the cargo plane to strike a mountain.
Name: China

Summary: Crashed into a mountain during poor weather conditions.
Name: Colombia

Summary: Fuselage failure. Four were seriously injured and both the pilot and radio operator were killed.
Name: Germany

Summary: Loss of control after mechanical failure and crashed into the sea. Failure of the aileron control couplings resulting from severe vibration.
Name: France

Summary: The plane overran the runway in heavy rain, crashed into a field and burned while attemping to land.
Name: Indonesia

Summary: The cargo plane crashed after an attempted go-around.
Name: India

Summary: Struck a mountain.
Name: Italy

Summary: The cargo plane crashed en route.
Name: Mexico

Summary: The plane had just taken off from Cebu bound  for Manila when it crashed 20 miles NW of the city. President Ramon Magsaysay, 50, of the Philippines died along with twenty-three others when the plane struck Mt. Manunggal. Magsaysay was on a campaigning trip for reelection. Metal fatigue.
Name: Philippines

Summary: Crash landed in poor weather conditions. Icing.
Name: Russia

Summary: The plane crashed into the tower during an approach in adverse weather conditions.
Name: Brazil

Summary: The cargo plane crashed short of the runway in poor weather conditions.
Name: China

Summary: The cargo plane crashed into high ground while on apporach to land.
Name: Colombia

Summary: Crashed into hill while attempting to land.
Name: Germany

Summary: Crashed after the wing failed during takeoff.
Name: France

Summary: The aircraft flew into a plume from a volcanieruption at 37,000 feet during the night. All engines failed and the windshield lost transparency because of pitting. The first engine was restarted at 12,000 feet, followed by the other three and the plane landed safely at Jakarta. The aircraft was named 'City of Edinburgh.'
Name: Indonesia

Summary: The cargo plane crashed en route. A downdraft which forced down the fully loaded aircraft to the ground when it was flying under exceptionally severe weather conditions below 1000 ft. and possibly at a few hundred feet above the terrain.
Name: India

Summary: Disappeared and crashed into the ocean just off the coast of Terracina in clear weather. On board were an Egyptian Princess and her court. The cause remains unknown although sabotage is a possibility.
Name: Italy

Summary: The accident was due to a maneuvering error which consisted in making two turns onto the Mexico City heading without conforming the distance and procedure specifications and below the prescribed altitudes and speeds. This error was aggravated by a probable shifting of the load due to improper securing.
Name: Mexico

Summary: Crashed during takeoff.
Name: Philippines

Summary: Crashed into a mountain during daytime in poor weather. Failure of the crew to follow the correct approach path.
Name: Russia

Summary: The aircraft crashed into a 2,500 ft. mountain (Serra da Aratanha) during an approach in heavy rain and fog. Despite two altitude alert system warnings and the co-pilot's warning of the mountains ahead, the captain continued to descend below the minimum descend altitude. Non-observance of air traffiand carrier's procedures.
Name: Brazil

Summary: The cargo plane was shot down by Japanese fighters.
Name: China

Summary: Struck high ground.
Type: de Havilland Canada DHC-6 Twin Otter 300
Name: Colombia

Summary: Forced landing 40 miles from Berlin.
Name: Germany

Summary: Crashed while on approach to Lyons.
Name: France

Summary: Crashed during final approach. Hudbay Oil Co. charter.
Name: Indonesia

Summary: An improper flare on landing caused the aircraft to bounce causing the right wing to strike the runway after which the plane veered off the runway.
Name: India

Summary: A fire of undetermined origin erupted in the cockpit. The crew  was unable to control the smoke and flames, lost control and the aircraft and crashed. Eight aboard parachuted to safety.
Name: Italy

Summary: Crashed in a mountainous area in the Zimathan district while en route.
Name: Mexico

Summary: The cargo plane lost altitude and crashed into a house.
Name: Philippines

Summary: Lost engine power due to fuel exhaustion during approach and made a forced landing 1,450m short of the runway.
Name: Russia

Summary: The aircraft broke in two after a hard landing. The pilot's misuse of rain repellant caused an optical illusion.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Disappeared over the Himalayas.
Name: China

Summary: The aircraft was unable to gain altitude upon taking off. After turning left the plane struck a hill. Overloaded.
Name: Colombia

Summary: Weather related.
Name: Germany

Summary: The aircraft crashed in a storm.  Kathleen Kennedy Cavendish, 28, sister of  President John F. Kennedy, killed.
Name: France

Summary: A section of the tail separated in flight and the aircraft crashed into a swamp. Broken spigot fitting, which is part of  the elevator torque tube assembly. The part was not repaced as required.
Name: Indonesia

Summary: Crashed into a field shortly after takeoff. The aircraft crashed as a result of slipping into the ground in the course of a poorly executed steep turn to port, carried out at night at a low altitude.
Name: India

Summary: The plane disappeared after the pilot radioed he was exeriencing heavy icing and asked to divert to Rome.  The plane was found 5 months later on Mt. Meta.
Name: Italy

Summary: Lost an engine on takeoff and crashed into trees and caught fire.
Name: Mexico

Summary: Proceeding on instruments, the aircraft crashed into Mt. Tabayowhile en route.  Navigation error.
Name: Philippines

Summary: The cargo plane crashed into the Gulf of Finland shortly after taking off.
Name: Russia

Summary: Crashed into a tug boat and barges while on approach in heavy rain and wind and broke in two.
Name: Brazil

Summary: The cargo plane was caught in a downdraft in a mountain pass en route and crashed.
Name: China

Summary: The aircraft crashed short of the runway while attempting to land after a severe vibration required the crew to shut down the engine and feather the propeller.
Name: Colombia

Summary: Weather related.
Name: Germany

Summary: The cargo flight crashed into the sea.
Name: France

Summary: Hit high ground at 2,700 ft. in poor weather while on approach.
Name: Indonesia

Summary: The aircraft tried to return to the airport after the No. 1 engine failed on takeoff but was unable to maintain airspeed, stalled and crashed into a tree. Delay in feathering the No. 1 engine after failure. Improper emergency procedural errors by the pilot.
Name: India

Summary: The pilot radioed he was lost, shortly before impacting the ground while attempting to land in poor visibility.
Name: Italy

Summary: Crashed in a hilly region between Talpa and Mascota.
Name: Mexico

Summary: Cargo plane.
Name: Philippines

Summary: The cargo plane crashed after both engines flamed out during an approach to land.
Name: Russia

Summary: Crashed shortly after taking off.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Crashed while attempting to land after losing oil pressure on one engine.
Name: China

Summary: With one engine out and attempting an emergency landing the aircraft had to go-around because of a plane on the runway. While attempting a second landing from the opposite direction the aircraft ditched into a lake.
Name: Colombia

Summary: Engine failure.
Name: Germany

Summary: The aircraft was seen at Ste. Mere l'Eglise where it passed very low in poor weather and snow showers before crashing into the sea.
Name: France

Summary: Struck Mt. Sebayak at 5,500 ft. during its approach. Pilot error.The plane was named 'Mamberamo.'
Name: Indonesia

Summary: The test flight crashed after attempting to determine the cause of a crash at Nagpur on 12/12/1953.
Name: India

Summary: Crashed into a hill after encountering a fog bank and not climbing in sufficient time to avoid the terrain.
Name: Italy

Summary: Crashed and burned on Friar's Peak while waiting for permission to land.
Name: Mexico

Summary: Crashed  5 minutes after taking off from Mati.
Name: Philippines

Summary: The aircraft undershot on approach and crashed 1,700m short of the runway.  It is reported that the crew, who was apparently fatigued, failed to correctly follow procedures. The accident happened at night.
Name: Russia

Summary: Crashed while conducting a survey
Name: Brazil

Summary: Crashed 2 km from the Kunming Airdome shortly after takeoff.  Possible causes include engine failure,  overloading, sabotage and temporary blinding by a bright light.
Name: China

Summary: Crashed in the jungle on a mountain peak. Flying VFR in meteorological conditions below minima.
Name: Colombia

Summary: Crashed into trees a few hundred yards away from the runway while attempting to land at Le Bourget Airport.
Name: France

Summary: Struck Mt. Bromo at 6,200 ft. while en route..
Name: Indonesia

Summary: The aircraft experienced loss of control in too steep a turn. Loss of critical height during a steep left hand turn, with the landing gear down, executed by the pilot at an unsafe altitude in an attempt to return to the aerodrome, after experiencing a temporary loss of power of the left engine soon after becoming airborne. A false right engine fire warning precipitated the attempt at a forced landing.
Name: India

Summary: The sea plane crashed shortly after taking off.
Name: Italy

Summary: Crashed into a ravine.
Name: Mexico

Summary: The cargo plane crashed into the ocean.
Name: Philippines

Summary: A fire in the rear cargo hold and fire warning in both engines forced the plane to crash land in a snow laden field. The plane broke up after striking irrigation equipment. Short circuit in the electrical wiring.
Name: Russia

Summary: The plane crashed into a hill while landing during a thunderstorm. The pilot misjudged his speed and distance and failed to initiate a go-around. Improper flight supervision and control of the engines.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Crashed into mountains during a thunderstorm
Name: China

Operator: F.R. de la Direccion General de Ados
Summary: The aircraft crashed into a mountain at 9,500 ft. while descending to land. Continued VFR flight in deteriorating weather at low altitude in a mountainous area.
Name: Colombia

Summary: Pilot error.
Name: Germany

Summary: The cargo plane struck a mountain en route.
Name: France

Summary: After spotting a mountain in front of him, the pilot applied full power and went into a steep climb. The plane stalled and crashed into trees.
Type: de Havilland Canada DHC-6 Twin Otter 300
Name: Indonesia

Summary: Stalled following takeoff. An error of judgement by the pilot, who executed a steep starboard turn. He could not come out of the overbanked turn in time because of the low altitude. Inexperience of the pilot with the type of the aircraft which he was flying.
Name: India

Summary: The flying boat crashed into the Tyrrhenian Sea after the collapse of a wing.
Name: Italy

Summary: The cargo plane struck a tower in fog while attempting to land.
Name: Mexico

Summary: Crashed into tree tops on Mt. Banahaur. The pilot and 1 passenger survived.
Name: Philippines

Summary: Crashed right of the runway during an approach in haze and snow.
Name: Russia

Summary: Crashed after stalling.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Shot down by Japanese military fighters. The plane ran into 5 Japanese fighters and made an emergency landing at a remote field only to be machine-gunned while trying to escape.
Name: China

Summary: While en route a wing separated from the cargo plane which led to loss of control.  The wing attachment bolts failed in turbulence.
Name: Colombia

Summary: Broken wing strut.
Name: Germany

Summary: Lost control while landing and crashed.
Name: France

Summary: After overshooting the runway, a go-around was initiated but abrupt application of power made an engine autofeather after which the plane crashed.
Name: Indonesia

Summary: The cargo plane crashed in the Khasi hills. The port wing failed in the air due to an upload as a result of being subjected to loads greater than those for which it was designed.

Summary: Crashed into mountains.
Name: Italy

Summary: Descended below minima and struck a mountain. Did not heed GPWS warnings. Incorrectly set altimeter.

Summary: Crashed into the sea.
Name: Brazil

Summary: While en route from Hong Kong to Chungking, the aircraft was shot down by Japanese military fighters. The aircraft was named Kweilin.

Summary: A fire and explosion took place 5 minutes after taking off. The explosion was possibly caused by a bomb placed in the rear section of the aircraft.

Summary: Engine failure.
Name: Germany

Summary: The cargo plane struck high ground while en route.
Name: France

Summary: Landed short and struck trees while on approach in poor weather. VFR flight in weather conditions below minima.

Summary: Crashed into a mountain while en route in severe weather. The pilot descended in poor visibility in order to find his position.
Name: India

Summary: The flying boat crashed while attempting to take off. The aircraft was named Cygnus.

Summary: Flew into a mountain.
Name: Mexico

Summary: The aircraft struck the ground while the crew was in the base leg turn. Crew procedural errors. The radio altimeter warning was not set and the outer marker was not used during the approach.

Summary: Hit trees and burst into flames shortly after taking off.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Flew into a mountain.
Name: Colombia

Summary: Engine failure.
Name: Germany

Summary: Flew into 4,000 foot Mt. Moucherolles, 25 miles south of Grenoble. The crash started an avalanche which buried most of the wreckage.
Name: France

Summary: Crashed into a building while landing during poor weather conditions. The plane was blown against the building by a strong gust of wind.
Name: Indonesia

Summary: Lost an engine while on approach and crashed. Fuel starvation caused when the plane banked to make a turn and the tank being used had very little fuel in it.

Summary: Crashed on the slopes of Mount Basso, 20 miles from Turin.
Name: Italy

Summary: Crashed into a mountain while en route.
Name: Mexico

Summary: The crew failed to set the altimeters to the proper setting while landing. The plane descended until it contacted trees, broke up and caught fire. Crew fatigue was a factor.
Name: Russia

Summary: Crash landed in mountains during a snowstorm.

Summary: Engine failure.
Name: Germany

Summary: Crashed into mountains while en route. The pilot descended to lower altitiude to rid the plane of ice.

Summary: Crashed while en route.
Type: de Havilland Canada DHC-6 Twin Otter 100
Name: Indonesia

Summary: The cargo plane crashed while en route after losing an engine and attempting an emergency landing.

Summary: Crashed into a mountain.
Name: Italy

Summary: Crashed into a 15,000 ft. snow covered volcano, Mt. Popocatepetl.

Summary: Crashed during takeoff.

Summary: Destoryed in a storm.
Name: China

Summary: Illegal flight.

Summary: Weather related.
Name: Germany

Summary: Lost altitude after losing an engine on takeoff  and crashed into a factory yard.

Summary: Due to a compass error the aircraft became lost and crashed during a forced landing due to fuel starvation.

Name: India

Summary: The aircraft ditched in the ocean after encountering gale force winds. Sank while in tow. The plane was named 'City of Rome.'
Name: Italy

Summary: Crashed near the Leon publisquare and destroyed 3 homes. Lost an engine while taking off and was attempting to return to the airport.
Name: Mexico

Summary: The plane stalled and crashed after a loss of engine power on takeoff. The engine throttles were reduced at  a critical stage of the takeoff for undetermined reasons, probably by the crew.

Summary: Crashed on farmland six miles outside of Bogota shortly after taking off.
Name: Colombia

Summary: Weather related.
Name: Germany

Summary: Descended through clouds and crashed. Premature descent by the crew without establishing their position.  Training flight.

Summary: Crashed on approach, landing short of the runway, collapsing the landing gear. Awkward landing technique resulting in excessive rate of sink. Contributing factors include narrow runway, uneven runway necessitating landing as close to the threshold as possible and marginal weather conditions.
Name: Indonesia

Summary: The cargo plane crashed on takeoff.
Name: India

Summary: Crashed and burned moments after takeoff. Failure of the right engine.

Summary: The plane overran the runway while attempting to take off crashed into a building and was destroyed.

Summary: Struck a 7,000 ft. mountain in fog.

Summary: The cargo  plane struck power lines and crashed while attempting to take off.

Summary: The aircraft struck trees in fog during a missed approach 3 miles north of Dum Dum airport as the crew descended too low in poor visibility.

Summary: Crashed into an 11,000 ft. mountain obscured by clouds.

Summary: Crashed during takeoff.

Summary: Lost control and crashed when attempting to take off. Attempted to take off  with the autopilot engaged.

Summary: Crashed in poor weather conditions.

Summary: Crashed into Chingshan mountain range 10 miles south of Tsinan in fog.

Summary: The No. 1 engine failed and the plane crashed and burned when the left wing dropped and touched the runway.

Summary: Crashed in a storm.

Summary: Crashed into a mountainside in a snowstorm.

Summary: The aircraft struck Mt. Burangrang . Attempt by the pilot to fly over mountainous terrain when unsure of his position and in weather conditions which severely restricted visibility.

Summary: Cargo plane.

Summary: Crashed into mountainous terrain.
Name: Mexico

Summary: The aircraft crashed in a forest after an in-flight fire caused by baggage that ignited in the rear cargo hold led to loss of contol of the aircraft.

Summary: The plane crashed into houses after taking off and burst into flames. The plane had engine trouble, attempted to return to the airport when it crashed into the houses.

Summary: Crashed into a lake while on approach.
Name: Colombia

Summary: Exploded and burned near Neuwerk Island,  when hydrogen gas, being vented, was ignited by lightning.

Summary: Crashed in severe turbulence in thunderstorms after losing the right wing and breaking up.

Failure of the right engine, a lack of precaution on the part of the captain and marginal weather. A contributing factor may have been the overloaded condition of the aircraft, however, not to such an extent that it forced the aircraft to descend to a dangerously low altitude.

Summary: Flew into a mountain due to a navigational error.

Summary: Crashed en route

Summary: The aircraft overan the runway after an aborted takeoff. Passenger died of heart attack.

Name: Brazil

Summary: The cargo plane crashed into the ocean. Engine failure.
Name: Colombia

Summary: Lost altitude while in a turn and attempting to land and crashed and burned.
Name: France

Name: Indonesia

Summary: The left wing separated from the plane in extreme turbulence from a thunderstorm.
Name: India

Summary: Crashed on a second test flight.

Summary: The aircraft entered a left bank and turn, stalled and crashed 5 miles short of the runway. Failure of the autofeather sensor circuit breaker caused propellers to feather.

Summary: Hit an 11,620 ft. mountain in poor weather.
Name: Colombia

Summary: The aircraft went in to a spin and crashed in a wooded area and caught fire.

Summary: Veered off the runway and crashed into a ditch..
Name: Indonesia

Summary: The cargo plane lost an engine on takeoff and attempted an emergency return but crashed. Overloaded.
Name: India

Summary: Crashed into mountains and caught fire.  The plane was carrying mainly German tourists.

Summary: Crashed into the Caspian sea after reporting an engine fire.

The plane descended from a height of about 70 meters and struck approach lights.

Summary: The cargo plane struck trees and broke up on a second landing attempt in poor weather.

Summary: Missing on a flight from France to Spain. Shot down by an American Bristol Beau allied night fighter.

Summary: The aircraft crashed while attempting an emergency landing after the No. 3 engine caught fire. Failure of a  compressor.

Summary: While on a go-around the aircraft attained a nose up attitude, stalled and crashed. Loss of power in the No.1 engine at a critical stage of the landing.

Summary: The cargo plane barely took off when it settled back on the runway and crashed into a DC-6. Both planes destroyed.

Summary: Shot down by anti-aircraft fire during the Normandy invasion.

Summary: The cargo plane crashed en route.
Name: Colombia

Summary: Shot down by anti-aircraft fire during the Normandy invasion.
Name: France

Summary: The aircraft lost control and crashed just after taking off. The captain losing control in conditions of poor visibility, resulted in the aircraft flying into the ground. Decision to take off in poor weather conditions and faulty lighting system.

Summary: The aircraft crashed after the elevator failed. Disconnection of the linkage of the elevators control rod.

Summary: Crashed in mountainous terrain,  50 miles north of Rio de Janeiro, while on approach.

Summary: Crashed  on its inaugural flight.

Summary: Shot down by anti-aircraft fire during the Normandy invasion.

After the bank angle reached 90 degrees the aircraft crashed short of  the runway.

Summary: The aircraft tried to return to the airport after an engine fire but the right wing struck trees and it crashed in the Amazon jungle.

Summary: Minutes after taking off in a rainstorm the right wing struck a tree. The crew lost control of the plane and crashed.

Summary: The aircraft crashed into lake Bolomon after engine failure during takeoff.

Summary: Struck an 11,000 ft. mountain.

U.S. Representative from Georgia Lawrence McDonald killed.

Summary: Crashed and burned in mountains while en route. Improper flight planning by proceeding in mountainous terrain during adverse weather conditions which had reduced visibility along the route.

Summary: Inadvertently shot down by French anti-aircraft fire.

Summary: Broke up in midair and crashed.

Summary: Crashed into Guajara Bay, short of the runway while on approach during a storm.

Summary: The aircraft crashed while attempting to land.

Summary: Crashed into the Himalaysas and burned while en route.

Summary: The cargo plane crashed into a mountain at 7,000 ft. shortly after taking off.

Summary: Crashed in fog within a few miles of it's destination near Bourget Airport.

Summary: Penetrated a thunderstorm and broke-up.

Summary: Tried to return to the airport for an emergency landing after an engine failed.

Summary: The aircraft lost control and crashed after a tailplane failure. Failure in-flight of the tailplane spar causing the left tailplane and elevator the detach.
