Summary: About 30 minutes after taking off, the aircraft turned back to Mato Grosso with its left engine on fire. While over Buracao, it's left wing and engine broke away from the fuselage and it crashed to the ground.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Struck a hill in heavy fog. Flying VFR in IFR conditions.
Name: Colombia

Summary: The mail plane crashed into mountains 50 miles from Toulouse in fog.
Name: France

Summary: Cashed into trees shortly after taking off.
Name: India

Summary: Struck a mountain.
Name: Russia

Summary: Crashed into Mt. Nova. Deviated off course for unknown reasons.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Midair collision. Seventeen aboard the HK-134 and twenty-one aboard the HK-107 killed.
Name: Colombia

Summary: Shifting cargo caused the pilot to lose control and crash into a hotel.
Name: Russia

Summary: Crashed into trees during initial approach in heavy fog. Error in judgment by the pilot in attempting to fly visually in unfavorable weather conditions during twilight.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Disappeared while en route. Wreckage found 3 days later.
Name: Colombia

Summary: The plane descended below the decision height without having established ground contact and crashed into a wooded area.
Name: Russia

Summary: The aircraft returned to airport after the No. 2 caught fire. The crew feathered the prop, made a left turn, stalled and crashed into a house. Improper feathering procedure.
Name: Brazil

Summary: The aircraft struck a mountain in rain and thunderstorms operating as a non-scheduled passenger airliner run by the military.
Name: Colombia

Summary: The crippled airliner crashed into houses and burst into flames as it was coming in for an emergency landing in steady rain.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Crashed shortly after leaving Bogota after an explosion aboard.
Name: Colombia

Summary: Chief pilot of Air France, Robert Bajac, 36, killed.
Name: France

Summary: The aircraft lost control and crashed after an uncommanded flap extension at FL270.
Name: Russia

Summary: Crashed short of the runway, striking trees. The aircraft descended below the prescribed altitude for undetermined reasons.
Name: Brazil

Summary: The aircraft crashed and burned short of the runway. A girl, 6, and a boy 3, were the only survivors.
Name: Colombia

Summary: Crashed on approach.
Name: Russia

Summary: Crashed 9 miles short of its destination. Cause unknown. The aircraft was named Estevao Ribeiro Baiao Parente.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Crashed while attempting to return to the airport after reporting an overspeeding propeller.
Name: Colombia

Summary: The aircraft crashed while en route in a severe snowstorm.  Icing. The aircraft was named 'Emeraude.'
Name: France

Summary: The plane crashed after entering the wake turbulence of a helicopter.
Name: Russia

Summary: Midair collision with a Cessna at 2,400 m. Twenty-three killed on the Saab, three on the Cessna. Both pilots failed to maintain adequate lookouts for other aircraft.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Crashed into a mountain, 30 miles from its destination after being diverted because of a severe storm.
Name: Colombia

Summary: The aircarft crashed in freezing rain and fog shortly after taking off. The aircraft was overloaded. The pilot had very little experience flying aircraft type.
Name: Russia

Summary: Rejected takeoff. Overran runway into the sea. Incorrect stabilizer setting. Stablizer setting changed from nose-up to nose-down position. Delayed decision to abort takeoff.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Crashed shortly after taking off.
Name: Colombia

Summary: Crashed into high ground in fog after losing an engine. The plane was named 'City of Washington.'
Name: France

Summary: Crashed into trees short of the runway while on approach. Approach not carried out in accordance with company procedures and misjudgement of his distance from the runway.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Crashed into the southern slopes of Tajumbina Peak at 11,600 ft. while approaching Cali. Lack of cockpit discipline. Consuming alcohol shortly before the flight. Not following the recommended route. Incorrectly reported positions. Continuing VFR in IFR conditions. Flying below minimum safe altitude for a VFR approach.
Name: Colombia

Summary: The airship was on its inaugural flight from Cardington, England to Karachi, (Pakistan). During a storm on the first night, it suddenly nosedived, leveled briefly, then dived again crashing and burning. Preparations had been rushed for political reasons and there had been no full-speed test flight. In the wind and rain, the outer cover split open at the front so that the two forward gasbags ruptured simultaneously. Dropping ballast raised the nose, but only because there was also dynamilift, which was promptly lost as speed was reduced, presumably to save the remaining gasbags.
Name: France

Summary: After reaching an altitude of about 100 m, the aircraft lost altitude, collided with a eucalyptus forest and was destroyed. Pilot error. Failure to operate under IFR in adverse weather conditions at night. Failure to follow the climb procedure.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Crash landed short of the runway on approach in fog. Pilot error. Presence of unauthorized person in the cockpit distracting the pilot. Lack of cockpit supervision. Poor weather.
Name: Colombia

Summary: Crashed into the Mediterranean in fog.
Name: France

Summary: Crashed after the left engine flamed out on takeoff.
Name: Russia

Summary: The flight crashed into a hill during approach. Pilot error. Improper evaluation of distance, flying a non-standard traffipattern by night and failing to observe altitude minima during the final approach.
Name: Brazil

Summary: The cargo plane struck trees at the end of the runway after trying to make an emergency landing. Material failure consisting in fatigue failure of a number of teeth of the pinion of the governor control unit, which was jammed against the rack in the 'up' position and therefore set for maximum rpm, thus causing the engine to overspeed. This would be in keeping with the fact that the dome ring was at maximum low pitch setting, i.e. high rpm and a runway propeller on take-off.
Name: Colombia

Summary: The flight engineer accidentally shut off the automatitransferring of fuel from the sump tank. Eventually all three engines stopped and the plane crashed. Fuel starvation.
Name: Russia

Summary: Crashed while attempting to land.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Crashed shortly after taking off. The plane rose less than 100 ft. and then crashed into shallow water.  Possible engine failure. Maintenance error and inadequate inspections.
Name: Colombia

Summary: Crashed into high ground in fog.
Name: France

Summary: The aircraft, which deviated off course, suffered rapid decompression after being fired upon by a Russian fighter. The aircraft made an emergency landing on a frozen lake.
Name: Russia

Summary: The No.2 engine failed while en route. The aircraft lost altitude, crashed in a jungle and burned. Starboard engine failed to feather for reasons unknown.
Name: Brazil

Summary: The plane crashed while en route. Flight on an prohibited route in adverse weather. Flight VFR in IFR conditions.
Name: Colombia

Summary: Crashed in fog.
Name: Russia

Summary: Crashed into Guanabara Bay during approach. Cause undetermined.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Midair collision between a Douglas DC-3 and Piper PA-18.  Eighteen killed on the DC-3, one on the Piper.
Name: Colombia

Summary: The plane crashed after an aborted landing.
Name: Russia

Summary: While taking off, the plane drifted to the right, overcorrected to the left and struck two other aircraft. Pilot error.  Incorrect use of the brakes and controls while on the ground.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Crashed into Pan de Azucar Peak, 35 nm from Bucaramanga. Flying under VFR in IFR conditions.
Name: Colombia

Summary: The plane crashed during takeoff in poor weather conditions.
Name: Russia

Summary: Midair collision between a DC-3 and a US Navy R-6D. Improper piloting procedures when flying on authorized instrument flight (US Navy pilot). The pilot of the USN plane disobeyed instructions transmitted by Rio Approach Control. The U.S. Navy disagreed and placed no blame on neither pilot. Twenty six killed on the DC-3, 35 on the R-6D-1. Members of the United States Navy Band among those killed.
Name: Brazil

Summary: The cargo plane touched down, bounced twice, climbed and crashed. Improperly loaded cargo.
Name: Colombia

Summary: Midair collision at FL187.  ATC error. Fifty-two deaths on the Antonov, 38 on the Yak. Violation of separation rules. Contributing causes were insufficient visual alertness on the part of both crews and a lack of situation analysis based on air/ground radio communications.
Name: Russia

Summary: Midair collision with a Brazilian Air Force AT-6 Harvard, shortly after takeoff. One killed in the fighter. Failure of both pilots to see and avoid each other.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Crashed during final approach. Evasive maneuver to avoid a mid-air collision with another aircraft caused the pilot to lose control of the aircraft.
Name: Colombia

Summary: The aircraft plunged to earth from FL 260. Electrical power failure of compass, gyros and auto pilot.
Name: Russia

Summary: Crashed a few minutes after taking off from Sao Paulo Airport. Cause undetermined.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Crashed in heavy rain while en route. Pilot error. Flight under VFR in IFR conditions.
Name: Colombia

Summary: Crashed during takeoff.
Name: Russia

Summary: The plane descended over Guanabara Bay in rain, struck the water with the nosewheel and crashed on Flecheiras Beach, short of the runway. Descent below minima for reasons unknown. Crew fatigue possible.
Name: Brazil

Summary: While taking off, the aircraft began to veer to the left. The pilot corrected to avoid a collision with the T wind indicator and crossed into the parking apron. The pilot applied full power and decided to take off from the apron. The starboard wing struck two helicopters, cart wheeled and burst into flames. Pilot error. Poor flight technique, faulty judgment in trying to take off outside of the main runway.
Name: Colombia

Summary: The plane rolled to the left and crashed into houses after takeoff. Failure of both artificial horizons.
Name: Russia

Summary: Crashed on takeoff after the No.1 engine failed. Pilot error. Pilot's incorrect handling of controls in flight.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Nothing was heard from the aircraft after departing Bahia Solano. The wreckage was found 4 days later, 31 miles from the airport on Bonito Peak at an elevation of 2,400ft.
Name: Colombia

Summary: Crashed in poor weather.
Name: France

Summary: Crashed shortly after taking off.
Name: Russia

Summary: The aircraft crashed after a second landing attempt. Improper approach procedure. Incorrect forcast provided to the crew.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Due to winds, the aircraft was 10 degrees off course as it prepared to land at Villavicencio and crashed into a 11,500 ft. mountain.
Name: Colombia

Summary: The aircraft crashed after report of a heavy vibration and fire in the No. 4 engine. Structural failure of turbine disin No. 4 the engine.
Name: Russia

Summary: Crashed on approach. Cause unknown.
Name: Brazil

Summary: After taking off the crew of the cargo plane declaired an emergency and crashed shortly after. The faulty procedure on the part of the pilot who made the en route climb from Manizales to San Felix at a low altitude, so that the aircraft became trapped in a canyon and crashed in the San Felix pass at La Aguadita after stalling during a turn at 9,000 ft.
Name: Colombia

Summary: On a positioning flight the aircraft crashed past the end of the runway. Failure of the artificial horizon.
Name: Russia

Summary: Crashed during approach after encountering a downdraft. Missed the runway and collided with a tree. Windshear.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Crashed during final approach. The pilot failed to take proper action to counteract the loss of speed and height in the final approach turn. Lack of pilot experience.
Name: Colombia

Summary: The cargo plane crashed.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Forced landing after engine failure. The accident was attributed to an error in judgment by the pilot in deciding to land at an airport which was closed and where no radio aid was available. Contributing factors were intermittent overspeeding of propellers, adverse weather and no communication tower.
Name: Colombia

Summary: A midair collision occurred in poor visibility approximately 18 miles north of Beauvais, France. This was the  first commercial midair collision in aviation history. Two killed on the de Havilland, five on the Faman F-60.
Type: de Havilland DH-18 / Farman F-60 Goliath
Name: France

Summary: The aircraft crashed after the wing touched the ground while landing short of the runway.
Name: Russia

Summary: The plane abandoned the takeoff after an engine failed. The plane was unable to stop and slid off the runway striking rocks and catching fire. Failure of No. 4 engine. Malfunctioning of the starboard brakes.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Crashed en route.
Name: Colombia

Summary: Crashed at Le Bourget field.
Name: France

Summary: Struck high ground after going off course during a go-around.
Name: Russia

Summary: The cargo plane lost the No. 1 engine on takeoff and crashed.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Disappeared en route. Right landing gear found on Moron Island.  Cause undetermined.
Name: Colombia

Summary: Crashed while making an approach to Le Bourget Airport in Paris.
Name: France

Summary: The aircraft crashed shortly after takeoff while on a go-around. After reaching an altitude of 1,200 ft. the aircraft banked to the left which steepened until the plane began to descend and finally crashed. Malfunctioning artificial horizon.
Name: Russia

Summary: While en route, fire broke out in the starboard engine. As he lost altitude and because of reduced visibility, the pilot did not see the peak of a mountain. When he tried to pull up the plane stalled and crashed. Engine failure.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Pilot did not follow prescribed route nor follow prescribed IFR procedures.
Name: Colombia

Summary: After making a right turn, the aircraft plunged to earth from 1,500 ft.  Electrical failure of the compass and main gyro.
Name: Russia

Summary: Shortly after  takeoff, a fire developed in the left main landing gear well. The pilot thought the fire had started in the engine, feathered the No.1 engine and returned for an emergency landing. When he couldn't get the gear down, he performed a go-around after which the left wing separated from the plane. The plane crashed and burned. Fracture of the fuel line in the landing gear housing due to wear against the ribs.
Name: Brazil

Summary: The starboard engine failed shortly after takoff and  the plane crash into Quetame Hill, 25km northwest of Santa Cecilia  Airport. Complete failure of the starboard engine due to the breakdown of the lubricating system. Recklessness of the pilot in taking off from a closed airport while aware of the poor weather conditions. The aircraft was also overloaded.
Name: Colombia

Summary: Crashed, broke up and burst in flames while on second approach after descending below glide slope. Icing of tailplane.
Name: Russia

Summary: Incorrect use of flying controls during takeoff roll.  Possible failure of left engine. Turbulent conditions close to ground.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Hit El Rucio Mountain at 6,200 ft. which was obscured by clouds. Lack of cockpit discipline. Flight on instruments at an excessively low altitude for the route.
Name: Colombia

Summary: The aircraft entered a spin and dove into the ground.
Name: Russia

Summary: The plane struck an object in the water while landing and broke up.
Name: Brazil

Summary: The cargo plane crashed with a gold and platinum shipment aboard. Wreckage found one month later.
Name: Colombia

Summary: The plane went into a spiral dive. As the crew tried to pull the plane out it broke up due to excesss g loads. Four survived the crash as the plane landed in a blanket of snow but succumbed to the cold before they could be rescued.
Name: Russia

Summary: Crashed on takeoff.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Crashed into the Caqueta river while landing.
Name: Colombia

Summary: The aircraft lost altitude while taking off and crashed. The copilot responded to the captain's 'gear-up' command by reaching forward and pulling back on the ground spoiler handle, rather than lifting the gear handle which was immediately ahead of the spoiler control. Late night partying by the crew was suspected the night before.
Name: Russia

Summary: Shortly after taking off, the No.1 engine lost power. The crew shut off the hydraulipump which caused the landing gear to stop retracting halfway. The resulting drag, caused the aircraft to lose altitude. The left wing struck a tree and the plane crashed and burned. Failure of the front bearing of the propeller shaft leading to disconnection of the reduction gear and left propeller and causing a sudden failure of the left engine.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Crashed into a mountain 1 hour after takeoff.
Name: Colombia

Summary: The flight ditched into Black Sea shortly after takeoff. The accident occurred in good weather and visibility, and ground controllers received no distress message prior to the crash. An investigation failed to reveal its cause.
Name: Russia

Summary: Hit Caparao Mountain while en route, 1 hour after taking off.  Failure to follow flight plan.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Cargo plane.
Name: Colombia

Summary: The aircraft crashed, trailing heavy smoke. Fire caused by spontaneous ignition of passenger baggage.
Name: Russia

Summary: After an aborted landing attempt due to a unlocked landing gear, the plane made a left turn, hit a pole, crashed and burned. Pilot error. Improper use of the throttles by the crew following the go-around. Failure of the landing gear locking mechanism.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Crashed short of runway during approach.
Name: Russia

Summary: The plane was attemping to return to the Rio de Janeiro after severe vibrations in the No. 1 engine made the crew feather the prop.  While on final the aircraft came in too high and a go-around was attempted during which the plane crashed into the sea.   Lack of reference to instruments after opening the throttle to go-around in restricted visibility.  Power may have been inadvertently reduced on the good engine.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Crashed while on a flight to Cartagena.
Name: Colombia

Summary: The plane crashed during a go-around.
Name: Russia

Summary: The aircraft crashed while attempting to land at Salvador. Engine failure at a critical stage in landing.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Cargo plane.
Name: Colombia

Summary: Crashed on takeoff
Name: Russia

Summary: The cargo plane crashed on takeoff. Elevator lock was not removed prior to takeoff.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Crashed and burned 19 miles east northeast of Fonseca well off course. Cause unknown.
Name: Colombia

Summary: Crashed while taking off. Icing.
Name: Russia

Summary: The aircraft deviated from its normal course by 30 miles and struck a mountain. Navigational error. The minimum safety height for the route was not complied with.
Name: Brazil

Summary: While landing at Irkutsk Airport the aircraft landed short of the runway after an excessive rate of sink. The left wing separated and the plane burst into flames.
Name: Russia

Summary: Crashed while on final approach to Sao Paulo. Error of judgement by the crew during poor visibility at night.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Crashed while attempting to land.
Name: Colombia

Summary: Aileron oscillations coincided with flap extension. The crew misunderstood aileron oscillations for asymmetrical flap extension and retracted the flaps. The airspeed dropped to 172 knots and the aileron suddenly deflected causing a left roll. The aircraft undershot the runway and crashed. The hinge moment reversal on the ailerons caused by icing.
Name: Russia

Summary: The pilot aborted the takeoff after loosing the No. 2 engine and was unable to stop on the remaining runway. Error of judgment on the part of the pilot in not continuing the takeoff with three engines still operating
Name: Brazil

Summary: Crashed shortly after taking off from Bogata.
Name: Colombia

Summary: The plane crashed during takeoff on a flight to Erevan.
Name: Russia

Summary: After being cleared to land the aircraft struck high ground and burst int flames. Navigational error in not knowing where the aircraft was located. Poor weather.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Struck the side of Galeras Volcano.
Name: Colombia

Summary: Lost three engine while taking off and crashed. Malfunctioning fuel system.
Name: Russia

Summary: Exploded in midair. A bomb exploded aboard.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Crashed in the Andes mountains while  en route.
Name: Colombia

Summary: The aircraft crashed after colliding with a balloon.
Name: Russia

Summary: A woman was suck out of the plane . The flight engineer's failure to recognize an unsafe condition of the cabin door despite three completely separate warnings of that condition and the captain's action in continuing flight while pressurized despite the several warnings that the main cabin door was not properly locked.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Crashed on approach.
Name: Russia

Summary: The cargo plane lost an engine while taking off, stalled and crashed. Failure of maintenance staff to remove the flying control locks.  Failure of one engine for reason undetermined.
Name: Brazil

Route: Medellin, Colombia - San Jose, Costa Rica
Summary: Crashed shortly after taking off.
Name: Colombia

Summary: Crashed into high ground on approach after executing a premature descent.
Name: Russia

Summary: Crashed while attempting to make an emergency landing after experiencing an engine failure. Failure of the port engine due to accessory drive failure. Failure of the starboard engine due to seizure as a result of deficient maintenance. Error on the part of the crew in lowering the landing gear in emergency conditions.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Crashed in the Cordillera mountain range while en route.
Name: Colombia

Summary: Crashed on approach. Icing.
Name: Russia

Route: Rio de Janeiro - New York City
Summary: The flight crashed into the jungle about 887 nm NNW of Rio de Janerio. Separation of the propeller blade leading to separation of the No. 2 engine due to highly unbalance forces, leading to the distintegration of the aircraft. The aircraft was named 'Clipper Good Hope.'
Name: Brazil

Summary: The plane crashed into Mt. El Tabalazo at 10,500 feet in fog while en route.
Name: Colombia

Summary: Crashed short of the runway on approach. Icing.
Name: Russia

Summary: The right wing struck trees after attempting a go-around. Pilot error.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Crashed in the jungles of the Magdalena river valley.
Name: Colombia

Summary: Engine fire led to an emergency landing with the landing gear retracted.
Name: Russia

Summary: Crashed into a house shortly after taking off from Congonhas Airport.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Midair collision. Ninety-six killed on the An-12, 24 on the IL-14.
Name: Russia

Summary: Struck power lines while landing.
Name: Russia

Summary: Crashed during a landing attempt in adverse weather conditions under VFR and hit high ground. The pilot attempted a visual approach and made a turn at low altitude in adverse weather conditions.
Name: Brazil

Summary: A collision occurred between the two Ford Tri-Motors as one was barely off the ground and one was still on the ground at Olaya Herrera Airfield. The accident was officially attributed to wind sheer or the one aircraft being blown into the other aircraft as it took off. Rivalry among the two pilots may have played a part in the accident as one pilot had buzzed the other four days before the accident..  Actor, singer, Carlos Gardel, 44, and his lyricist Alfredo Le Pera, 35, among those killed.
Name: Colombia

Summary: Soviet cosmonaut Yuri Gagarin, 34, the first man in space, was killed along with his instructor, when the military fighter they were training in crashed approximately 30 miles east of Moscow.
Name: Russia

Summary: Crashed into high ground while on a VFR apporach in IFR conditions. The pilot attempted a descent over an area where the minimum safe altitude was 1,200 ft.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Scadta was a Pan Am subsidiary.  It was operating a domestiflight, which crashed in the Colombian jungle, which was called 'Green Hell.' Five Goigira Indians, who were canoeing up the Uribe River, found pieces of clothing, and then dead bodies of five people from the crash, and the wreckage of the aircraft.  They also found a man who was alive, but dazed, exhausted, half crazy and unable to speak.  They carried him for seven days through the jungle to civilization.  He later recovered, and his name was Newton C. Marshall, General Manager of South American Gold & Platinum Company.  He was the only survivor.
Name: Colombia

Summary: Cruising at flight level 260, some type of emergency developed. An abrupt descent was begun and accelerated until aerodynamiforces broke apart the plane. Cause unknown.
Name: Russia

Route: Santa Cruz de Rio Prado - Presidente Prudent
Summary: Hit a mountain in fog. Pilot's decision to fly VFR in unfavorable weather conditions.
Name: Brazil

Summary: The plane climbed to 700 ft. and crashed into the ground. Malfunctioning artificial horizon and compass.
Name: Russia

Summary: The No. 2 engine failed on a go-around in reduced visibility and rain and the aircraft crashed into the ocean.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Crashed into a snowbank on the takeoff roll in poor visibility.
Name: Russia

Summary: The aircraft crashed after losing its No. 1 engine on takeoff. Engine failure during takeoff. Pilot error. Short takeoff procedure used on an airfield where such a maneuver was not necessary.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Crashed during approach.
Name: Russia

Summary: The aircraft flew into power lines during a landing attempt after running out of fuel while in a holding pattern.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Crashed shortly after taking off.
Name: Russia

Summary: During descent into dense cumulonimbus  clouds, severe turbulence was encountered which caused displacement of freight that led to an uncontrolled dive which resulted in the wings separating from the fuselage. Structural failure due to severe turbulence during a thunderstorm. Pilots decision to descend without clearing the turbulent area of weather.
Name: Brazil

Summary: After insisting on and getting a direct approach without completing a standard traffipattern, the airliner crashed into a wooded hillside. The controller lacked the radar with which to monitor the flight. Blame was placed on both the crew of the airliner and the ATC. Lack of radar facilities. Premature descent. Inexperience with the area and poor flight planning.
Name: Russia

Summary: Crashed into a mountainside while circling to land. Crew error. Lack of flight discipline.  Poor decision by Chief of Operations in allowing the aircraft to continue flight in poor weather conditions.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Both the No. 1 and No. 2 propellers detached in flight which led to the crew ditching the plane close to shore.
Name: Brazil

Summary: After the landing gear did not retract  after takeoff the flight was diverted to Leningrad because of fog.  After circling for a long time the plane began to lose it's engines because of fuel starvation and a ditch was carried out in River Neva.
Name: Russia

Summary: Twenty minutes before arriving a Porto Alegre, a fire was discovered in cargo hold 'G.'  The pilot executed an emergency descent while the crew tried to extinguish the flames to no avail. As the plane attempted to land, the panicking passengers rushed to the front of the plane to escape the flames causing the center of gravity to change, resulting in a hard landing. The cause of the fire in the hold 'G' was not determined.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Crashed 2 miles short of the runway during approach. Premature descent.
Name: Russia

Summary: The aircraft crashed into a mountain shortly after taking off from Florianpolis.
Name: Brazil

Summary: The plane stalled and crashed.
Name: Russia

Summary: The aircraft crashed shortly after taking off. Engine failure due to fuel contamination.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Crashed on takeoff on a test flight. Rudder controls improperly installed.
Name: Russia

Summary: A blown tire during takeoff led to damage to the landing gear, engine and oil line. Lack of oil caused loss of the engine and the crew was not able to feather the prop. This led to overspeeding and an engine fire. The plane made a spiral descent and crashed to the ground.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Struck a mountain while attempting to land. Changes in the approach patterns for Sochi Airport, not approved by the State aviation authorities and without informing the flight crews about it.  Inadequacies of flight control and crew training in the Sochi area and training for flights in mountainous regions in general.
Name: Russia

Summary: The cargo plane lost control and crashed shortly after leaving the runway. The pilot did not apply the procedure recommended by the airline and attempted to make a turn after takeoff below the specified altitude of 100 meters.
Name: Brazil

Summary: The plane crashed into a mountain during an approach to Adler Airport. The accident was caused by a change in approach patterns to the airport on the part of controllers without approval from aviation authorities.  Lack of training by the carrier for flights into mountainous regions.
Name: Russia

Summary: Struck the Sierra Cristais.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Crashed after a premature descent.
Name: Russia

Route: Rio de Janerio, Brazil - Cayenne, French Guianan
Summary: The plane, carrying Brazilian service personnel and their dependents crashed and burned while en route.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Crashed on approach to Moscow, 11 nm short of the runway. Malfunctioning or misread altimeter.
Name: Russia

Summary: Crashed into the Solimoes extension of the Amazon river.
Name: Brazil

Summary: The plane was on a flight from Peking to Moscow at FL330 when it went out of control. The aircraft experienced extreme turbulence during a climb, stalled and plunged to earth and burned. The captain described everything as it happened as he attempted to recover from the uncontrolled descent, ending the radio transmission with a farewell.
Name: Russia

Summary: Poor weather at the destination airport forced the crew to divert to Rio de Janeiro. While approaching to land the aircraft flew into a mountain, 14 miles from the airport.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Shot down by Soviet Mig fighters.
Name: Russia

Summary: Crashed into a mountainside north of Rio de Janerio.
Name: Brazil

Summary: The aircraft stalled after flying over a thunderstorm. The aircraft climbed in excess of its operational ceiling considering its weight.
Name: Russia

Summary: The aircraft descended below safe altitude and struck the ground in rain and poor visibility. The crew's application of an approach procedure other than that prescribed by the airport authority.
Name: Russia

Summary: Crashed en route.
Name: Russia

Summary: Crashed in fog.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Crashed during takeoff.
Name: Russia

Summary: Crashed into a river.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Struck a Naval Academy building while attemptin to take off.  The plane then broke in two and fell into the harbor. The plane was named 'City of Rio de Janiero.'
Name: Brazil

Summary: The plane overshot the runway and collided with a military aircraft killing at least 70 people.
Name: Russia

Summary: Crashed in a mountain range while enroute.
Name: Brazil

Summary: The airship crashed while on a trial flight in preparation of rescuing  Russian scientists on an ice floe in Greenland. The airship crashed into the side of a mountain.
Name: Russia

Summary: Midair collisioin with a private plane.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Midair collision with an I-5 fighter at 2,300 ft. The fighter was performing aerobatics trying to loop around the Tupolev. The plane crashed into a residental neighborhood and was on its maiden flight. The plane was nicknamed 'Maxim Gorky.'  Pilot error. Forty-nine killed on the Tupolev, one on the I-5
Name: Russia

Summary: The plane lost power from the left engine, yawed to the left, and started a descending turn in the same direction. The plane continued to lose altitude and turn at a sharper and steeper angle until it struck a caisson anchored at right angles to a small island in the harbor immediately adjacent to its landing approach path.   Loss of power from the left engine during the landing approach, necessitating an attempted landing under extremely hazardous conditions.
Name: Brazil

Summary: The seaplane crashed in flames in mountains northeast of Rio de Janeiro.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Flew into a mountain wave after taking off, went into a dive and crashed into Guanabara Bay.
Name: Brazil

Summary: The mail plane crashed while taking off.
Name: Brazil

Summary: The postal plane crashed at Atalaya Beach.
Name: Brazil

Summary: Crashed into the sea.
Name: Brazil

Summary: The aircraft's wingtip struck the water and crashed into Rio de Janeiro Bay.
Name: Brazil
